text: "Mom" is a song recorded by Welsh singer Bonnie Tyler for her album Rocks and Honey (2013). Country superstar Garth Brooks covered the song on his 2014 album Man Against Machine. ==Background== Bonnie Tyler first heard the song being performed at a session in the Bluebird Cafe, Nashville, Tennessee. She selected the song to appear on Rocks and Honey. ==Critical reception== Carys Jones from Entertainment Focus described "Mom" as "a beautifully written song." ==Garth Brooks version== Garth Brooks covered the song on his 2014 album Man Against Machine. He performed it live on Good Morning America in November 2014, receiving a great deal of media attention in promotion of his album. It was released as the album's second single on November 24, 2014, available for digital download exclusively through Brooks' online music store, GhostTunes. ===Chart performance=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Chart (2014–15) ! Peak position |- |- |- |} ==Other versions== A version by The Nashville Nuggets debuted at number 46 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs chart for the week of December 13, 2014. Another version was covered by the a cappella band Home Free and was released on YouTube on April 29, 2015. Donna Taggart released this as a single in 2015. Filipino independent artist Jules Rancher released a cover of the song on March 22, 2019. ==References== Category:Bonnie Tyler songs Category:2013 songs Category:2014 singles Category:Garth Brooks songs Category:RCA Records Nashville singles Category:Songs written by Wynn Varble Category:Songs written by Don Sampson Category:Songs about parenthood
title: Mom (Bonnie Tyler song)
